sn4.24:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Uruvelā on the bank of the river Nerañjarā at the foot of the Goatherd’s Banyan Tree.
sn4.24:1.3: Now on that occasion Māra the Evil One had been following the Blessed One for seven years, seeking to gain access to him but without success.
sn4.24:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and addressed him in verse:
sn4.24:2.1: “Is it because you are sunk in sorrow That you meditate in the woods?
sn4.24:2.2: Because you’ve lost wealth or pine for it,
sn4.24:2.3: Or committed some crime in the village?
sn4.24:2.4: Why don’t you make friends with people?
sn4.24:2.5: Why don’t you form any intimate ties?”
sn4.24:3.1: “Having dug up entirely the root of sorrow,
sn4.24:3.2: Guiltless, I meditate free from sorrow.
sn4.24:3.3: Having cut off all greedy urge for existence,
sn4.24:3.4: I meditate taintless, O kinsman of the negligent!”
sn4.24:4.2: And those who speak in terms of ‘mine’—
sn4.24:4.3: If your mind exists among these,
sn4.24:5.1: “That which they speak of is not mine,
sn4.24:5.2: I’m not one of those who speak [of mine].
sn4.24:5.3: You should know thus, O Evil One:
sn4.24:5.4: Even my path you will not see. ”

sn4.24:6.3: Be off and walk that path alone;
sn4.24:6.4: What’s the point of instructing others?”
sn4.24:7.1: Ask what lies beyond Death’s realm.
sn4.24:7.2: “Those people going to the far shore
sn4.24:7.3: When asked, I explain to them
sn4.24:8.1: “Suppose, venerable sir, not far from a village or a town there was a lotus pond
sn4.24:8.2: in which a crab was living.
sn4.24:8.3: Then a group of boys and girls would leave the village or town and go to the pond. They would pull the crab out from the water and set it down on high ground.
sn4.24:8.4: Then, whenever that crab would extend one of its claws, those boys and girls would cut it off, break it, and smash it to bits with sticks and stones.
sn4.24:8.5: Thus, when all its claws have been cut off, broken, and smashed to bits, that crab would be unable to return to that pond.
sn4.24:8.6: So too, venerable sir, all those distortions, manoeuvres, and contortions of mine have been cut off, broken, and smashed to bits by the Blessed One.
sn4.24:8.7: Now, venerable sir, I am unable to approach the Blessed One again seeking to gain access to him. ”
sn4.24:8.8: Then Māra the Evil One, in the presence of the Blessed One, recited these verses of disappointment:
